column4: actually there is harm in that, but not in a desktop scenario I guess
No you're going to make him doubt me :P
not sure how the Ubuntu folks did that, probably using moz-plugger
Why doesn't it do it for me :( ubuntu 8.04
not sure, what happens when you click on a PDF?
It just brings up the save as dialog
I had a very delayed response there, girlfriend rang :P
do you have Evince installed? was your system upgraded or clean-installed? did you use that same home directory with other systems/versions?
when in doubt, make the clean-user test, make a new clean Ubuntu user with an empty home, log into it and see how it behaves
Was upgraded unfortunately but I keep it pretty clean. Although it being due to the upgrade makes sense.
could be mozilla-plugin related settings in your home dir, do the clean user test
I'll worry about it later cause I should be drawing a java class diagram for uni. But test user sounds like a good idea.
have fun diagraming... what are you using for that btw?
Nothing as of yet... I was in the middle of asking if anybody knew of any good software for UML diagrams... I usually just draw them in GIMP or something stupid like that.
